question.questionA: Leaves and longer bracts laterally compressed, hollow with transverse septa but not longitudinal septa.
question.questionB: Leaves and bracts not laterally compressed, transverse septa absent or accompanied by longitudinal septa.

question.questionA: Annuals; stems up to 40 cm but rarely that long.
question.questionB: Perennials; stems up to 100 cm or more.

question.questionA: Stems exceededbyan extended bract; inflorescence apparently lateral.
question.questionB: Stems not exceeded by an extended bract; inflorescence obviously terminal.

question.questionA: Stems distinctly ridged; leaves and lowest bracts not ending in spiny points.
question.questionB: Stems not distinctly ridged; leaves and lowest bracts ending in spiny points.

question.questionA: Rhizomatous perennials, up to 100 cm; tip of lower bract prickly; flowers straw-coloured; capsule shorter than the perianth or barely exceeding it.
question.questionB: Caespitose perennials, up to 150 cm; tip of lower bract ending in a stout very sharp spine; flowers reddish brown; capsule greatly exceeding the perianth.

question.questionA: Leaves, without septa; inflorescence ascending; perianth segments acute.
question.questionB: Leaves with both longitudinal and transverse septa; inflorescence spreading; perianth segments blunt, incurved.
